Japanese: Aでない
Explanation: Used to express a reversal of meaning, negation, etc. in relation to A.

Japanese: AなぜならばB
Explanation: Used to express that there is a reason B for A.

exp: [If the condition is 1st_arg, then it is 2nd_arg]
Japanese: もしAならばBである
Explanation: Used to express that, in relation to a condition A, it is B.

Japanese: AだからB
Explanation: Used to express that B is a proper reason, cause, trigger or condition for a proposition in relation to A.

Japanese: AしかしB
Explanation: Used to express that B is a contradiction or conflict in relation to A.

Japanese: AかつB
Explanation: Used to express the case where both A and B are true.

Japanese: AまたはB
Explanation: Used to express the case where either A or B is true.

exp: [If the condition is 1st_arg, then it is 2nd_arg, otherwise it is 3rd_arg]
Japanese: もしAならばBである，そうでなければCである
Explanation: Used to express that, with respect to a condition A, B is true. And is used to express that, with respect to a condition other than A, it is C.

Japanese: AかつBでない
Explanation: Used to express the case where both A and B aren't true.

Japanese: AまたはBでない
Explanation: Used to express the case where either A or B isn't true.

Japanese: Aは存在する
Explanation: It is used to express the existence of a thing or concept called A.

Japanese: 動詞から名詞に変換する
Explanation: Make nouns from A [verb].

Japanese: 修飾語から名詞に変換する
Explanation: Make nouns from A [modifier].

exp: [The part of speech makes the noun nonsensical]
Japanese: 品詞が名詞の無意味の語を作る
English: The part of speech makes the noun nonsensical
Explanation: None[noun]

Japanese: AはBで(F)ある
English: A F(Verbs such that A means equal to B) B
Explanation: Used to express that a thing or concept A is equal to B. And F is a verb such that A means equal to B.

exp: [1st_arg has the property that 3rd_arg | 2nd_arg is Verb]
Japanese: AがBという性質が(F)ある
English: A F(Verbs such that A means equal to B) B
Explanation: It is used to express that an object or concept A has the property B. And F is a verb such that A means equal to B.

Japanese: AはBを所有している/AはBを含んでいる
Explanation: It is used to express that B owns an object or concept A. And F is a verb.

Japanese: AはBに所属している/AはBに含まれている
English: A belongs to B/A is included in B
Explanation: It is used to express that B belongs to an object or concept A. And F is a verb.

Japanese: AはCより（Bという比較基準で）大きい
English: A is more B than C
Explanation: Used to express comparative expressions between A and C. It thereby means 'A is more B than C'. And F is a verb.
Condition: type(A)==Noun AND type(F)==Verb AND type(B)==Modifier AND type(C)==Noun

Japanese: AはF（～する）
Explanation: It is used to indicate that an actor called A performs an action called F.

Japanese: AはBをF（～する）
Explanation: It is used to express that an actor called A performs an action called F on an object called B.

exp: [1st_arg : Subject | 2nd_arg : Verb | 3rd_arg : Indirect Object | 4th_arg : Direct Object]
Japanese: AはBにCをF（～与える）
Explanation: It is used to describe the action of an actor, A, performing an action, F, on an object, C, towards an object, B.
Condition: type(A)==Noun AND type(F)==Verb AND type(B)==Noun AND type(C)==Noun

Japanese: AはBをCの状態にF（～する）
Explanation: It is used to express that an actor called A performs an action called F in order to make an object called B have the property C.
Condition: type(A)==Noun AND type(F)==Verb AND type(B)==Noun AND type(C)==Noun

Japanese: AはBをCの状態にF（～する）
Explanation: It is used to express that an actor called A performs an action called F in order to make an object called B have the property C.
Condition: type(A)==Noun AND type(F)==Verb AND type(B)==Noun AND type(C)==Modifier

Japanese: A（～ですか）[疑問]
Explanation: Make the phrase A into a question.

Japanese: A（～しろ）[命令]
Explanation: Make the phrase A an imperative.

Japanese: A（～した）[過去]
Explanation: Make the phrase A into a sentence expressing the past.

Japanese: A（～するだろう/する予定である）[未来]
English: A(will do / be going to do)
Explanation: Make the phrase A into a future or scheduled sentence.

Japanese: A（～する）行為が存在する
English: There is an act of A
Explanation: It is used to express the existence of the action A.

Japanese: 修飾語から動詞に変換する
Explanation: Make verbs from A [modifier].

Japanese: 名詞から動詞に変換する
Explanation: Make verbs from A [noun].

exp: [The part of speech makes the verb nonsensical]
Japanese: 品詞が動詞の無意味の語を作る
English: The part of speech makes the verb nonsensical
Explanation: None[verb]

Japanese: A（～する）にB（～く/～に）[副詞]という意味を付加する
English: Adding the meaning of B to A [verb]
Explanation: Used to add the meaning B to the action A.

Japanese: A（～される）[受動]
Explanation: Make the act A passive.

Japanese: A（～している）[継続]
Explanation: The act A is made into a form that expresses continuity or persistence.

Japanese: A（～したことのある）[経験/完了/結果/継続]
Explanation: Make a form that expresses the result or experience of completing the act of A.

Japanese: A（～な/～の/～に/～く）[形容詞/副詞]という修飾語が存在する
English: There is a modifier [adjective/adverb] called A
Explanation: It is used to express the existence of the modifier A.
Make modifiers from A [noun].

Japanese: 動詞から修飾語に変換する
Explanation: Make modifiers from A [verb].

exp: [The part of speech makes the modifier nonsensical]
Japanese: 品詞が修飾語の無意味の語を作る
English: The part of speech makes the modifier nonsensical
Explanation: None[modifier]

Japanese: AにB[副詞]という意味を付加する
English: Adding the meaning of B to A [modifier]
Explanation: Used to add the meaning B to the modifier A.

Japanese: Aでなく
Explanation: The degree of the adjective is negatively normal for a given adjective. In the original sense, "small". For example, this function can express 'bad' for 'good'.

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is some kind of person or creature']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの人や生物」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some kind of person or creature'
Explanation: Person or creature

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_argi s some object or concept']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの物や概念」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some object or concept'
Explanation: Object or concept

exp: [Limit a noun to '1st_arg is some time']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの時間」と限定する
English: Limit a noun to 'A is some time'
Explanation: Time

exp: [Limit a noun to '1st_arg is some place']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの場所」と限定する
English: Limit a noun to 'A is some place'
Explanation: Place

exp: [Limit a noun to '1st_arg is some reason']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの理由」と限定する
English: Limit a noun to 'A is some reason'
Explanation: Reason

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is some way or tool or means']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの方法や道具や手段」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some way or tool or means'
Explanation: Ways, tools or means

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is some kind of human being']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの人間」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some kind of human being'
Explanation: Human

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is some kind of animal']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの動物」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some kind of animal'
Explanation: Animal

exp: [Limit the noun to '1st_arg is some kind of plant']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの植物」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'A is some kind of plant'
Explanation: Plant

exp: [Limit the noun to '1st_arg is some kind of material']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの材料」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'A is some kind of material'
Explanation: Material

exp: [Limit a noun to '1st_arg is some starting point']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの始点」と限定する
English: Limit a noun to 'A is some starting point'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'from' in English  when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit a noun to '1st_arg is some end point']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの終点」と限定する
English: Limit a noun to 'A is some end point'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'to' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit a noun to '1st_arg is some interval']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの区間」と限定する
English: Limit a noun to 'A is some interval'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'between' or 'among' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの中」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is in some'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'in' or 'into' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの外」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is out some'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'out' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの上」と限定する
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'over', 'above' or 'on' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの下」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is below some'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'under', 'below' or 'on' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is grounded to something']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかに接地している」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is grounded to something'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'on' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの右」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some right'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'right of' or 'on' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの左」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some left'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'left of' or 'on' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit nouns to 'something that 1st_arg affects in some way']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの影響を与えるものや関連していること」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'something that A affects or is related to in some way'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'by', 'about' or 'for' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit noun to 'something that 1st_arg is affected by in some way']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの影響が与えられるもの」と限定する
English: Limit noun to 'something that A is affected by in some way'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'with' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit the noun to 'something that 1st_arg is near or related to']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが近くにあるものや関連しているもの」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'something that A is near or related to'.
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'near', 'about', 'with' or 'by' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: Limit nouns to those with motion, such as '1st_arg crosses', '1st_arg passes' or '1st_arg heads'.
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが横切る」や「Aが通る」「Aが向かう」と動きのあるものに限定する
English: Limit nouns to those with motion, such as 'A crosses', 'A passes' or 'A heads'.
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'to', 'through', 'around', 'into', 'across', 'along', 'over', 'under', 'up', 'down' or 'past' etc. in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を静止のあるものに限定する
English: Limit nouns to those with static
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'in', 'at'  or 'on' etc. in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

Japanese: 名詞を「すべてのA」と限定する
Explanation: All

Japanese: 名詞を「多くのA」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'many A', 'much A' or 'a lot of A'
Explanation: Many

Japanese: 名詞を「いくつかのA」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'some A', 'a few A' or 'several A'
Explanation: Some

Japanese: 名詞を「ある（一つの）A」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'a certain A', 'one certain A'.
Explanation: One

Japanese: 名詞を複数形にする
Explanation: Plural

Japanese: 名詞を強調形する
Explanation: It is added to the noun that is most emphasised in a given sentence. However, it is usually not added to the subject. It is particularly useful when a noun is explained by a relative pronoun and a subordinate clause, where the noun being explained is a noun other than the genitive of the subordinate clause.

Japanese: 所有代名詞を作成する
Explanation: Make A a possessive pronoun

Japanese: 再帰代名詞を作成する
Explanation: Make A a reflexive pronoun

Japanese: 名詞を「Aなど」と限定する
Explanation: Used where there are other.

Japanese: ～的/～のようなもの/名詞を抽象化する
Explanation: DeterminerN.abstract(Noun.M2N(Modifier(A))) to represent an abstract concept for A. Modifier.N2M(DeterminerN.abstract(A)) to make A a modifier of the figurative expression.

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is in front of some space']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの空間的に前」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is in front of some space'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'in front of' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is behind in some space']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの空間的に後ろ」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is behind in some space'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'behind' in English when combined with Modifier.N2M().

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is some time in the future']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの時間的に未来」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some time in the future'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'after' in English regarding time.

exp: [Limit nouns to '1st_arg is some time in the past']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの時間的に過去」と限定する
English: Limit nouns to 'A is some time in the past'
Explanation: Similar meaning to 'before' and 'ago' in English regarding time.

Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの男性や雄」と限定する
English: Limit noun to 'A is some male'
Explanation: Male

exp: [Limit the noun to '1st_arg is some female']
Japanese: 名詞を「Aが何らかの女性や雌」と限定する
English: Limit the noun to 'A is some female'
Explanation: Female

Japanese: 私
Explanation: Represents one-person pronouns(Person).

Japanese: あなた
Explanation: Represents two-person pronouns(Person).

Japanese: 彼/彼女/それ
Explanation: Represents third-person pronouns.

Japanese: これ
Explanation: Represents a proximal pronoun.

Japanese: それ/あれ
Explanation: Represents a distal pronoun.

Japanese: どれ
Explanation: Represents an interrogative determiners.

Japanese: どれか
Explanation: Represents an indefinite pronouns.

Japanese: 生み出す/作る/産む
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Produces something'.

Japanese: 破壊する/壊す/死ぬ
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Destroys something'.

Japanese: 行動する/動く/実行する/歩く/働く
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Someone acts'.

Japanese: 回る/回転する/急ぐ/走る
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Something turns'.

Japanese: 感じ取る/受信する/受け取る/入れる/摂取する/取得する/得る/習う/聞く/見る/食べる/飲む
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Receive something'.

Japanese: 発する/発信する/発射する/出す/送信する/送る/教える/刺激する/言う/話す/攻撃する
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Something stimulates something'.

Japanese: ある/いる/存在する/生きている/住んでいる/留まる/止まっている/休む
Explanation: The original meaning is 'the state in which something stays and exists’.

Japanese: 使う/使用する
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Something uses something'.

Japanese: 変わる/なる/成長する/移行する/移動する
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Something changes'.

Japanese: 大きい/長い/広い/高い/多い/重い
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Big'.

Japanese: 近い/親しい/似ている/好きである
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Near'.

Japanese: 良い/新しい/若い/美しい
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Good'.

Japanese: 明るい/白い/色鮮やかな
Explanation: The original meaning is 'Bright'.

Japanese: 偽
Explanation: Bool type to indicate False. It is a binary zero.

Japanese: 真
Explanation: Represents a Bool type True. It is a binary number 1.

Japanese: AはBである（Bは真偽）
English: A is B (B is true or false)
Explanation: Assigns true/false to Noun types.

Japanese: 真偽のリスト（BoolList）を作成する
Explanation: Creates an empty BoolList, which can be used to manage multiple Bool types.

Japanese: BoolList(A)のB番目の値を取得する
English: Gets the B-th value of BoolList(A)
Explanation: A is the target BoolList and B is the index BoolList. In this case, B is a natural number.

exp: [Add one Bool to the end of the BoolList]
Japanese: BoolListに1つのBoolを末尾に加える
English: Add one Bool to the end of the BoolList
Explanation: Add the Bool value B to the end of the BoolList A.

exp: [Get the 2nd_arg-th through 3rd_arg-th lists for a BoolList (1st_arg).]
Japanese: AというBoolListに対して，B番目からC番目までのリストを取得する
English: Get the B-th through C-th lists for a BoolList (A).
Explanation: A is the target BoolList, and B and C are the index BoolLists. In this case, B and C are natural numbers. Also included are B and C.

Japanese: 2つのBoolListを結合する
Explanation: Combines two BoolLists, A and B, and returns them.

exp: [Create a BoolList consisting of 2 Bool values]
Japanese: 2つBoolの値からなるBoolListを作成する
English: Create a BoolList consisting of 2 Bool values
Explanation: Create a 2-bit BoolList.

exp: [Create a BoolList consisting of 4 Bool values]
Japanese: 4つBoolの値からなるBoolListを作成する
English: Create a BoolList consisting of 4 Bool values
Explanation: Create a 4-bit BoolList.
Condition: type(A)==Bool AND type(B)==Bool AND type(C)==Bool AND type(D)==Bool

exp: [Create a BoolList consisting of 8 Bool values]
How to use: mos X1 X2 X3 X4 X5 X6 X7 X8
Japanese: 8つBoolの値からなるBoolListを作成する
English: Create a BoolList consisting of 8 Bool values
Explanation: Create a 1-byte BoolList.
Condition: type(X1)==Bool AND type(X2)==Bool AND type(X3)==Bool AND type(X4)==Bool AND type(X5)==Bool AND type(X6)==Bool AND type(X7)==Bool AND type(X8)==Bool

Japanese: BoolListを2進数の自然数とみなす
English: BoolList is considered a binary natural number
Explanation: treats a number in BoolList as a natural binary number.

Japanese: BoolListを2進数の整数とみなす
English: BoolList is considered a binary integer
Explanation: treats a number in BoolList as a binary integer. It is also interpreted as an IEEE754 "single-precision floating-point number". Therefore, it must be 32 bits.

Japanese: BoolListを2進数の浮動小数とみなす
English: BoolList is considered a binary floating number
Explanation: treats a number in BoolList as a binary floating decimal number.

Japanese: BoolListをASCII文字とみなす
English: BoolList is considered an ASCII character
Explanation: treats a number in BoolList as an ASCII character.

exp: [Set up a function that returns 2nd_arg named 1st_arg with a certain LangList as an argument]
Japanese: あるLangListを引数とするAという名前のBを返す関数を設定する
English: Set up a function that returns B named A with a certain LangList as an argument.
Explanation: Set before using the function. It is not possible to set more than one function with the same name.

Japanese: LangFunc.setFunc()の引数用に使用する
Explanation: When defining a function for the second argument of LangFunc.setFunc(), this value can be substituted for the argument when executing the function when it is needed.

exp: [Execute the configured LangFunc named 1st_arg with argument 2nd_arg]
Japanese: 設定したAという名前のLangFuncを引数Bとして実行する
English: Execute the configured LangFunc named A with argument B
Explanation: Executes the set function. Unconfigured function names cannot be executed.

Japanese: LangObjのリストLangListを作成する
Explanation: Creates an empty LangList, which can be used to manage multiple LangObj types.

Japanese: LangList(A)のB番目の値を取得する
English: Gets the B-th value of LangList(A)
Explanation: A is the target LangList and B is the index BoolList. In this case, B is a natural number.

exp: [Add one LangObj to the end of the LangList]
Japanese: LangListに1つのLangObjを末尾に加える
English: Add one LangObj to the end of the LangList
Explanation: Add the LangObj value B to the end of the LangList A.

exp: [Get the 2nd_arg-th through 3rd_arg-th lists for a LangList (1st_arg).]
Japanese: AというLangListに対して，B番目からC番目までのリストを取得する
English: Get the B-th through C-th lists for a LangList (A).
Explanation: A is the target LangList, and B and C are the index BoolLists. In this case, B and C are natural numbers. Also included are B and C.

Japanese: 2つのLangListを結合する
Explanation: Combines two LangLists, A and B, and returns them.
